etymologies: Old English fyr(e)st; of Germanic origin, related to Old Norse fyrstr and German Fürst ‘prince’, from an Indo-European root shared by Sanskrit prathama, Latin primus, and Greek prōtos

notes.text: First, second, third, etc., are adverbs as well as adjectives: first, dice three potatoes; second, add the bouillon. Firstly, secondly, etc., are also correct, but make sure not to mix the two groups: first, second, third; not first, secondly, thirdly. See also former

definitions: coming before all others in time or order; earliest; 1st

examples.text: his first wife
the first of five daughters

definitions: never previously done or occurring

examples.text: her first day at school

definitions: coming next after a specified or implied time or occurrence

examples.text: I didn't take the first bus

shortDefinitions: coming next after specified or implied thing

definitions: met with or encountered before any others

examples.text: the first house I came to

shortDefinitions: met with or encountered before any others

definitions: originally

examples.text: many valuable drugs have been recognized first as poisons

definitions: before doing something else specified or implied

examples.text: Do you mind if I take a shower first?

definitions: for the first time

examples.text: she first picked up a guitar out of sheer boredom

definitions: firstly; in the first place (used to introduce a first point or reason)

examples.text: first, it is wrong that the victims should have no remedy

definitions: in preference; rather (used when strongly rejecting a suggestion or possibility)

examples.text: she longed to go abroad, but not at this man's expense—she'd die first!

definitions: the first occurrence of something notable

examples.text: we traveled by air, a first for both of us

definitions: the first in a sequence of a vehicle's gears

examples.text: he stuck the car in first and revved

definitions: first base

examples.text: he made it all the way home from first

definitions: the first grade of a school.
a first edition of a book

examples.text: collectors of modern firsts

definitions: foremost in position, rank, or importance

examples.text: the doctor's first duty is to respect this right
I always put myself first
football must come first

definitions: the most likely, pressing, or suitable

examples.text: he is the first to admit he was not the best of patients
his first problem is where to live

definitions: the first finisher or position in a race or competition.
shortDefinitions: first finisher or position in race

definitions: performing the highest or chief of two or more parts for the same instrument or voice

examples.text: the first violins

shortDefinitions: highest or chief of instrumental or vocal parts

definitions: a place in the top grade in an examination, especially that for a degree

examples.text: he took a first in Classics

definitions: a person having achieved a top grade in an examination.
shortDefinitions: person achieving top grade in examination

definitions: goods of the best quality

examples.text: factory firsts, seconds, and discontinued styles

definitions: with a specified part or person in a leading position

examples.text: it plunged nose first into the river

shortDefinitions: with specified part in leading position
